headline: Muhlenberg College to host first Pennsylvania Senate Democratic debate; John Fetterman still ‘under discussion’ to attend
author: Jennifer Sheehan
sentences: Hosted by City & State PA, Pennsylvania Kitchen Table Politics, the Muhlenberg College Institute of Public Opinion and the Muhlenberg College Democrats student organization, the 75-minute debate will be in front of a live audience and will be broadcast.
Pundits believe Pennsylvania could be one of Democrats’ best shots of picking up a seat in the Senate after President Joe Biden narrowly carried the state in the 2020 election.
Muhlenberg College will host the first debate of Democratic candidates for U.S. Senate next month, the school announced Monday.
State Rep. Malcolm Kenyatta and U.S. Rep. Conor Lamb have been confirmed for the event April 3.
John Fetterman, is “under discussion,” according to a news release from Muhlenberg.
The event will take place 3-4:15 p.m. April 3 before 175 invitation-only guests.
Republican Sen. Pat Toomey announced last year he would not seek another term.
There are more than a dozen GOP candidates running to replace Toomey.
More details about the broadcast will be released later.
Attendance by the third Democratic candidate, Lt. Gov.
